Class MiddlegameBoardEvaluator

java.lang.Object
engine.forPlayer.forAI.MiddlegameBoardEvaluator
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardEvaluator
public class MiddlegameBoardEvaluator extends Object implements BoardEvaluator
The MiddlegameBoardEvaluator class provides comprehensive position evaluation specifically tuned for middlegame positions in chess. This evaluator implements modern chess engine evaluation principles including material balance, piece mobility, king safety, pawn structure, piece coordination, space control, attacking potential, and special positional patterns.

The evaluation function considers multiple strategic and tactical factors that are most relevant during the middlegame phase, where piece development is complete and complex tactical and strategic battles typically occur.

Author:
Aaron Ho

    • get

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(Board board, int depth)
      Evaluates the given board from the perspective of the current player and returns a score. The evaluation is calculated as white's score minus black's score, making positive values favorable for white and negative values favorable for black.
      Specified by:
      evaluate in interface BoardEvaluator
      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      depth - The search depth in the AI's thinking process.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score of the board.

    • score

      private double score(Player player, Board board)
      Calculates the overall score of the current board position for a given player using modern chess engine evaluation principles tuned for middlegame positions.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the board position is being evaluated.
      board - The current state of the chess board.
      Returns:
      The evaluation score of the board from the perspective of the specified player.

    • materialEvaluation

      private double materialEvaluation(Collection<Piece> playerPieces)
      Evaluates material balance with refined piece values and contextual adjustments. Modern engines use dynamic piece values based on the position.
      Parameters:
      playerPieces - The collection of pieces belonging to the player.
      Returns:
      The material evaluation score.

    • mobilityEvaluation

      private double mobilityEvaluation(Player player)
      Evaluates piece mobility, a critical factor in middlegame evaluation. Mobility represents how many squares pieces can move to or attack.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose mobility is being evaluated.
      Returns:
      The mobility evaluation score.

    • kingSafetyEvaluation

      private double kingSafetyEvaluation(Player player, Board board)
      Evaluates king safety, considering pawn shield, attacking pieces, open lines, and king attackers. This is a critical middlegame factor.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose king safety is being evaluated.
      board - The current chess board.
      Returns:
      The king safety evaluation score.

      Parameters:

      square - The square to check proximity to the king.
      Returns:

      The bad bishops evaluation score.

    • getPawnsOnSameColor

      private static int getPawnsOnSameColor(List<Piece> playerPawns, Piece piece)
      Counts the number of pawns on the same colored squares as the bishop.
      Parameters:
      playerPawns - The player's pawns.
      piece - The bishop piece.
      Returns:
      The number of pawns on the same colored squares.

    • evaluateQueenPositioning

      private double evaluateQueenPositioning(Collection<Piece> playerPieces, Board board, Alliance alliance)
      Evaluates queen positioning in the middlegame.
      Parameters:
      playerPieces - The player's pieces.
      board - The current chess board.
      alliance - The alliance of the player.
      Returns:
      The queen positioning evaluation score.

    • getSupportingPieces

      private static int getSupportingPieces(Collection<Piece> playerPieces, Alliance alliance, int rank)
      Counts the number of supporting pieces for a queen in an advanced position.
      Parameters:
      playerPieces - The player's pieces.
      alliance - The alliance of the player.
      rank - The rank of the queen.
      Returns:
      The number of supporting pieces.

    • calculateChebyshevDistance

      private int calculateChebyshevDistance(int position1, int position2)
      Calculates the Chebyshev distance between two squares.
      Parameters:
      position1 - The first position.
      position2 - The second position.
      Returns:
      The Chebyshev distance between the positions.

    • getPlayerPawns

      private static List<Piece> getPlayerPawns(Player player)
      Gets a list of pawn pieces for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pawns to retrieve.
      Returns:
      A list of the player's pawn pieces.
